com.camerontec.util.datatypes

Class MutableCompactDecimal

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.util.datatypes.MutableCompactDecimal
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DecimalView, Printable, Recyclable, Comparable<DecimalView>

    public final class MutableCompactDecimal
extends Object
implements DecimalView, Recyclable
    Class representing a mutable, limited precision, signed, normalized, decimal number.

    This class, unlike java.math.BigDecimal, does not offer arbitrary precision and is not a suitable substitute in all cases. However, objects of this class are mutable which makes them suitable for use in high frequency contexts when arbitrary precision is not required.

    The internal representation consists of a normalized (meaning that the mantissa and exponent are scaled together such that the mantissa is as small as possible without loss of precision) long mantissa and an int exponent. The equivalent value is thus: 

       value = mantissa * 10^exponent

    The range and precision of values which can be accommodated are therefore constrained by the above components. For example it is not possible to represent 1.0000000000000000001 because the resultant long mantissa (10000000000000000001) would exceed the maximum long value (9223372036854775807).

    Mathematical operations are implemented in terms of these components. Therefore all such operations are also constrained by the limitations of the long mantissa and int exponent. That is, when such operations would result in wrapping, overflow or an otherwise invalid change to either component they fail by way of throwing an java.lang.ArithmeticException.

    Specifically, the caller must always catch and handle this condition when using the following methods (unless it has specific and/or contextual knowledge of the underlying value):

    • intValue()
    • longValue()
    • add(DecimalView)
    • add(long)
    • subtract(DecimalView)
    • subtract(long)
    • multiply(DecimalView)
    • multiply(long)
    • divide(DecimalView)
    • divide(long)
    • abs()

    Equality comparisons are supported via:

    • equals(Object) - Returns true iff the parameter is another MutableCompactDecimal of equivalent value
    • equals(long) - Returns true iff the mantissa can be scaled such that it equals the parameter without loss of precision

    To perform other relational operations it is first necessary to convert each value to a built-in type and then compare directly using the required Java relational operator.

    This class it not thread safe in the context of concurrent modification on multiple threads.

      • doubleValue

        public double doubleValue()
        Description copied from interface: DecimalView
        Return the double value.

        The returned value is calculated as follows: 

           double value = mantissa * Math.pow(10.0, exponent);

        Note that this may result in a loss of precision as Java doubles cannot represent all floating point quantities.

        Specified by:
        doubleValue in interface DecimalView
        Returns:
        The double value.

      • bigDecimalValue

        public BigDecimal bigDecimalValue()
        Description copied from interface: DecimalView
        Return the BigDecimal value.

        The returned value is calculated as follows: 

           BigDecimal value = new BigDecimal(BigInteger.valueOf(mantissa), -exponent);
        Specified by:
        bigDecimalValue in interface DecimalView
        Returns:
        The BigDecimal value.

      • setValue

        public MutableCompactDecimal setValue(long value)
        Set the value.

        The mantissa and exponent are normalized by this call and so the caller should not necessarily expect the mantissa to equal the specified value following the call.

        Parameters:
        value - The new value.
        Returns:
        This object.

      • setValue

        public MutableCompactDecimal setValue(BigInteger value)
        Set the value from a BigInteger, throwing an exception in case of mantissa overflow.

        The mantissa and exponent are normalized by this call. It should be noted that a mantissa overflow can happen prior to the normalization. For example, setting the value to new BigInteger("100000000000000000000") will fail. Two valid alternatives to this call would be either setting the value to the "100000000000000000000" string, which normalizes on the fly, or to an equivalent but more compact BigDecimal, like new BigDecimal("1E20") for example.

        Parameters:
        value - A BigInteger value.
        Returns:
        This object.
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - in case of mantissa overflow

      • setValue

        public MutableCompactDecimal setValue(BigDecimal value)
        Set the value from a BigDecimal, throwing an exception in case of mantissa overflow.

        The mantissa and exponent are normalized by this call. It should be noted that a mantissa overflow can happen prior to the normalization. For example, setting the value to new BigDecimal("100000000000000000000") will fail. Two valid alternatives to this call would be either setting the value to the "100000000000000000000" string, which normalizes on the fly, or to an equivalent but more compact BigDecimal, like new BigDecimal("1E20") for example.

        Parameters:
        value - A BigDecimal value.
        Returns:
        This object.
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - in case of mantissa overflow

      • setValue

        public MutableCompactDecimal setValue(String value)
        Set the value from a string, throwing an exception in case of mantissa overflow.

        The supported pattern is as follows: <sign>? ( <digit>+ | <digit>* . <digit>+ )

        The mantissa and exponent are normalized by this call.

        Parameters:
        value - A string value.
        Returns:
        This object.
        Throws:
        NumberFormatException - if the given value does not follow the above pattern
        ArithmeticException - in case of mantissa overflow

      • add

        public MutableCompactDecimal add(DecimalView addend)
        Add a value to this value.

        This object is modified to contain the resultant sum as expressed by a normalized mantissa and exponent.

        Parameters:
        addend - The value to be added. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        This object.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the addend is null.
        ArithmeticException - On error during addition, which includes attempting to add a value which would result in mantissa overflow or an overall loss of precision.

      • multiplyPow10

        public MutableCompactDecimal multiplyPow10(int powerOfTen)
        Multiply this value by a power of 10.

        The result of this operation is equivalent to: 

           MutableCompactDecimal value = mantissa * 10^(exponent + powerOfTen)
        This method is designed to be used as a faster alternative when multiplying or dividing by a power of 10. The optimization is possible because it is sufficient to simply add the specified power to the existing exponent without modifying the mantissa.
        Parameters:
        powerOfTen - The power of 10.
        Returns:
        This object.
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - On error adding the specified power to the existing exponent.

      • divide

        public MutableCompactDecimal divide(DecimalView divisor)
        Divide this value by another value.

        This object is modified to contain the resultant quotient as expressed by a normalized mantissa and exponent.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        This object.
        Throws:

      • abs

        public MutableCompactDecimal abs()
        Set this value to its absolute value if possible without loss of precision.

        It is sufficient to set the mantissa to its absolute value except in the special case when the mantissa is equal to Long.MIN_VALUE. Taking the absolute value of Long.MIN_VALUE results in Long.MIN_VALUE. That is, it is not possible to take the absolute value without loss of precision so an ArithmeticException is thrown.

        Returns:
        This object.
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - If the absolute value cannot be computed without loss of precision.

      • negate

        public MutableCompactDecimal negate()
        Set this value to a value of equivalent magnitude and opposite sign.

        It is sufficient to negate mantissa except in the special case when the mantissa is equal to Long.MIN_VALUE. Negating Long.MIN_VALUE results in Long.MIN_VALUE. That is, it is not possible negate the value without loss of precision so an ArithmeticException is thrown.

        Returns:
        This object.
        Throws:
        ArithmeticException - If the absolute value cannot be computed without loss of precision.

      • round

        public MutableCompactDecimal round(int maxDecimalPlaces)
        Round this value to the nearest value according to the specified maximum number of decimal places.

        The rounding method is the same as RoundingMode.HALF_UP.

        Parameters:
        maxDecimalPlaces - The maximum number of decimal places required. Must be 0 or greater.
        Returns:
        This value.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If maxDecimalPlaces is negative
        See Also:
        RoundingMode.HALF_UP, MathUtils.round(MutableCompactDecimal, int, MutableCompactDecimal)
